title: Test Plan 1 for upsc_cse
questions:

    "title": "Test Plan 1: Data Fundamentals and Architecture",

    "questions": [
      {
        "topic": "Data Definitions",
        "difficulty": "easy",
        "question": "Which of the following is NOT a common definition of data?",
        "options": ["Information for analysis", "Information stored by computers", "Raw, unprocessed facts", "Information presented in various forms"],
        "answer": "Raw, unprocessed facts",
        "explanation": "While data can be raw, the definitions provided in the text focus on its use for analysis, storage, and presentation in various forms.  Raw, unprocessed facts are more accurately described as the raw material from which data is derived."
      },
      {
        "topic": "Big Data Characteristics",
        "difficulty": "medium",
        "question": "What are the 4 Vs of Big Data, plus the additional 'V' discussed?",
        "options": ["Volume, Velocity, Variety, Veracity, Value", "Volume, Velocity, Variety, Variability, Visualization", "Volume, Velocity, Variety, Veracity, Validity", "Volume, Value, Variety, Variability, Visualization"],
        "answer": "Volume, Velocity, Variety, Veracity, Validity",
        "explanation": "The core 4 Vs are Volume, Velocity, Variety, and Veracity.  The additional 'V' discussed is Validity, referring to the accuracy and trustworthiness of the data."
      },
      {
        "topic": "Data Classification",
        "difficulty": "medium",
        "question": "Which type of data conforms to schemas and data models?",
        "options": ["Structured Data", "Semi-structured Data", "Unstructured Data", "Multi-structured Data"],

        "explanation": "Structured data is organized according to predefined models, such as tables with rows and columns."

      {
        "topic": "Web Data",
        "difficulty": "easy",

        "options": ["Pull-based", "Push-based", "Client-server", "Request-response"],
        "answer": "Pull-based",
        "explanation": "Pull-based access occurs when the client initiates the request for data."
      },
      {
        "topic": "Big Data Types",
        "difficulty": "easy",
        "question": "Sensor data and logs are examples of which type of Big Data?",

        "explanation": "Sensor data and logs are automatically generated by machines."
      },
      {
        "topic": "Data Architecture",
        "difficulty": "hard",

        "answer": "Data Ingestion and Acquisition",
        "explanation": "This layer is responsible for gathering data from various sources and bringing it into the Big Data environment."
      },
      {
        "topic": "Data Pre-processing",
        "difficulty": "medium",
        "question": "Dealing with missing values and outliers is part of which process?",
        "options": ["Data Storage", "Data Processing", "Data Pre-processing", "Data Consumption"],
        "answer": "Data Pre-processing",
        "explanation": "Data pre-processing prepares the data for analysis by handling issues like missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies."
      },
      {
        "topic": "Cloud Computing",
        "difficulty": "easy",

        "options": ["IaaS", "PaaS", "SaaS", "None of the above"],
        "answer": "IaaS",
        "explanation": "Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) provides access to fundamental computing resources."
      },
      {
        "topic": "Distributed Computing",
        "difficulty": "hard",
        "question": "What is a potential drawback of Grid Computing?",
        "options": ["Scalability limitations", "High cost", "Single point of failure", "Complexity of implementation"],
        "answer": "Single point of failure",
        "explanation": "While grid computing offers advantages, a central node failure can disrupt the entire system."
      },
      {
        "topic": "Scalability",
        "difficulty": "medium",
        "question": "Adding more systems to distribute workload is an example of what kind of scaling?",
        "options": ["Vertical Scaling", "Horizontal Scaling", "Diagonal Scaling", "None of the above"],
        "answer": "Horizontal Scaling",
        "explanation": "Horizontal scaling involves adding more machines to the system, while vertical scaling involves increasing the resources of a single machine."
      }
    ]
  },

You can populate Test Plan 2 and Test Plan 3 using the same format, drawing questions from the provided content related to Big Data applications, risks, data quality, pre-processing techniques, and processing methods.
